terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
Printed Circuit Board - a board that connects electronic components using conductive tracks, pads and other features etched from copper sheets
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and collaborate safely
A centralized storage location where all project documents, specifications, and related files are organized and maintained
The process of ensuring that business operations and documentation meet all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards
The ability to track and document the history, application, or location of items through recorded identification numbers or audit trails
The process of generating reports automatically from data sources without manual intervention, reducing time and human error
Information that is processed and made available immediately as it is collected, without significant delay
Groups of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal, requiring shared access to documentation and information
Documentation systems designed to grow and adapt efficiently as the volume of content and number of users increases
The systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards through documentation and testing
The sequence of processes and procedures that materials follow during manufacturing, often documented for consistency and optimization
A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities affecting any operation or event
A single, unified system where all related tools, data, and processes are consolidated for easier management and access
